meanings.definition: Treat (a person or animal) badly or roughly.
meanings.sent1: The bully would mistreat the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent2: It is never okay to mistreat animals.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat would mistreat the toy mouse, thinking it was a real threat.
meanings.sent4: The storm mistreated the fragile flower petals, bending them under its force.
meanings.sent5: The villain in the story would mistreat anyone who dared to defy him.

meanings.definition: Handle or manage (a situation or thing) without care or respect.
meanings.sent1: You should never mistreat delicate items when packing them for a move.
meanings.sent2: It is important to not mistreat fragile equipment in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The careless chef would mistreat the fresh ingredients, resulting in a disastrous meal.
meanings.sent4: The reckless driver mistreated his car, causing it to break down on the highway.
meanings.sent5: The gardener would never mistreat the young plants, always handling them with care.
